channel.title: Brisbane s calendar Light up Brisbane
channel.description: This calendar includes scheduled lights ups of Council assets including Story Bridge, Reddacliff Place sculptures, Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City Hall, King George Square, William Jolly Bridge and Tropical Dome at Brisbane Botanic Gardens Mt Coot-tha.

item.title: National Road Safety Week
item.description:
Sunday, 11 May 2025

City Hall will be lit Yellow to support National Road Safety Week

National Road Safety Week (NRSW) is an annual initiative from the Safer Australian Roads and Highways (SARAH) Group, partnering road safety organisations and Government, partnering road safety organisations and Government to shine a spotlight on the importance of road safety. In 2025, NRSW will be held from 11-18 May.

This Light Up is organised by: Department of Transport and Main Roads

Light up asset: Brisbane City Hall, Brisbane City
Venue address: Brisbane City Hall, 64 Adelaide Street, Brisbane City
Venue type: General Council venue, Library, Light up asset

item.title: National Palliative Care Week
item.description:
Monday, 12 May 2025

Reddacliff Place sculptures will be lit Orange to support National Palliative Care Week

National Palliative Care Week (11-17 May 2025) seeks to raise awareness about the many benefits of quality palliative care, which helps people with life-limiting illnesses to live as well as possible, for as long as possible – supporting their physical, emotional, spiritual, and social needs.

This Light Up is organised by: Palliative Care Queensland Inc

Venue address: Reddacliff Place, 266 George Street, Brisbane City
Venue type: General Council venue, Light up asset

item.title: Eve of Apraxia Awareness Day
item.description:
Tuesday, 13 May 2025

Kangaroo Point Bridge will be lit Blue to support the Eve of Apraxia Awareness Day

Childhood Apraxia of Speech International Awareness Day is on May 14 and aims to raise awareness of apraxia. This severe speech disorder is as prevalent as cerebral palsy but never recognised. Childhood apraxia of speech is a type of speech disorder that is present from birth. A child with this condition has problems making sounds correctly and consistently, as it is a problem with the motor coordination of speech.

This Light Up is organised by: Murdoch Children's Research Institute - Apraxia Kids

Light up asset: Kangaroo Point Bridge, Kangaroo Point
Venue address: Kangaroo Point Bridge, Scott Street, Kangaroo Point
Venue type: General Council venue, Light up asset

item.title: Truck Week
item.description:
Wednesday, 14 May 2025

Kangaroo Point Bridge will be lit Blue Yellow Green to celebrate Truck Week

Truck Week, running form the 12th to 18th of May, is a week-long celebration of the heavy vehicle industry. This year’s events feature a free display of trucks on show throughout the South Bank precinct for the public to view. Other events include the Brisbane Truck Show, held at the Brisbane Convention and Exhibition centre May 15th to 18th, the Heavy Equipment and Machinery Show at the Brisbane Showgrounds, May 15th to 18th, and the Heritage Truck Show at the Rocklea Showgrounds May 17thand 18th.
Truck Week also focuses on promoting the heavy vehicle industry’s values around a set of key themes: safety, innovation, sustainability, careers, knowledge and community, with a goal to foster broader community awareness about the heavy vehicle industry’s vital role and positive impact within the community.

This Light Up is organised by: Brisbane Economic Development Agency

Light up asset: Kangaroo Point Bridge, Kangaroo Point
Venue address: Kangaroo Point Bridge, Scott Street, Kangaroo Point
Venue type: General Council venue, Light up asset

item.title: Eve of National Corrections Day
item.description:
Thursday, 15 May 2025

Reddacliff Place sculptures will be lit Blue to support Eve of National Corrections Day

National Corrections Day is a day for everyone to celebrate the unsung work of our corrective services officers across Queensland and raise awareness about the important work they undertake each day to make our communities safer for everyone

This Light Up is organised by: Queensland Corrective Services

item.title: Paniyiri
item.description:
Friday, 16 May 2025

Victoria Bridge will be lit Blue and White to celebrate Paniyiri

Paniyiri is Brisbane's festival of everything Greek, featuring an exciting cultural celebration of food, dance, music, art, cooking, live entertainment and history. item.title: IDAHOBIT
item.description:
Saturday, 17 May 2025

Story Bridge will be lit Rainbow to celebrate IDAHOBIT

Brisbane City Council - River City Pride wants to light up Brisbane in celebration and awareness of IDAHOBIT Day 2025 on it’s 35th Anniversary. On May 17, 1990 - the World Health Organization removed homosexuality from the Classification of Diseases and Related Health Problems. While we celebrate this milestone and other advancements in LGBTQIA+ equality, the unfortunate reality is that there's still more work to do

This Light Up is organised by: Brisbane City Council - River City Pride

Light up asset: Story Bridge, Kangaroo Point
Venue address: Story Bridge, Main Street, Kangaroo Point
Venue type: General Council venue, Light up asset

item.title: World Neurofibromatosis Awareness Day
item.description:
Sunday, 18 May 2025

Reddacliff Place sculptures will be lit Blue to support World Neurofibromatosis Awareness Day

May 17 is World Neurofibromatosis Awareness Day and the Children’s Tumour Foundation of Australia is joining cities all over the world in lighting up buildings and important landmarks blue and green to help raise awareness of NF. The Children's Tumour Foundation is the patient advocacy and support service for children, adults and families impacted by the genetic condition, neurofibromatosis in Australia

This Light Up is organised by: Children's Tumour Foundation of Australia

item.title: World IBD Day
item.description:
Monday, 19 May 2025

City Hall will be lit Purple to support World IBD Day

For more than three decades, Crohn’s & Colitis Australia has been empowering the more than 100,000 Australian's living with Crohn’s disease or ulcerative colitis collectively known as inflammatory bowel disease (IBD) to live fearlessly. CCA's primary purpose is to provide support services, advice, and encouragement to people with IBD. While we invest in research for a cure, CCA continues to advocate for world best treatments and health services for those living with IBD.

This Light Up is organised by: Crohn's & Colitis Australia

Light up asset: Brisbane City Hall, Brisbane City
Venue address: Brisbane City Hall, 64 Adelaide Street, Brisbane City
Venue type: General Council venue, Library, Light up asset

This Light Up is organised by: Crohn's & Colitis Australia

item.title: Domestic and Family Violence Prevention Month
item.description:
Tuesday, 20 May 2025

Kangaroo Point Bridge will be lit Purple to support Domestic and Family Violence Prevention Month

Domestic and Family Violence Prevention Month is an annual initiative held each May to continue to raise awareness of domestic and family violence and coercive control. The initiative aims to build community awareness of domestic and family violence and mobilise corporate and community action to end domestic and family violence in Queensland.

This Light Up is organised by: Department of Child Safety, Seniors and Disability Services

Venue address: Kangaroo Point Bridge, Scott Street, Kangaroo Point
Venue type: General Council venue, Light up asset

item.title: WOW Day (Wear Orange Wednesday)
item.description:
Wednesday, 21 May 2025

Reddacliff Place sculptures will be lit Orange to celebrate WOW Day (Wear Orange Wednesday)

Wear Orange Wednesday, or WOW Day is the national day to celebrate and thank SES volunteers. It takes place annually on the Wednesday of National Volunteer Week, this year taking place on Wednesday 21 May 2025. In honour of this day, we take the time to thank our Queensland SES volunteers for their dedication and tireless devotion to their communities.

This Light Up is organised by: Queensland State Emergency Service

Light up asset: Reddacliff Place, Brisbane City
Venue address: Reddacliff Place, 266 George Street, Brisbane City
Venue type: General Council venue, Light up asset

item.title: Sustainable BNE Festival
item.description:
Thursday, 22 May 2025

Reddacliff Place sculptures will be lit Green to celebrate Sustainable BNE Festival

Brisbane City Council, in partnership with the Brisbane Sustainability Agency, is proud to announce the launch of the Sustainable BNE Festival, an exciting evolution of the much-loved Green Heart Fair.

This transformation reflects Brisbane’s growing ambition to lead the way in sustainability by inspiring residents to embrace eco-friendly practices, shaping a cleaner and more sustainable future as the city prepares for the Brisbane 2032 Olympic and Paralympic Games. The Sustainable BNE Festival will take place on Sunday 25 May 2025 at Roma Street Parkland, with a goal to be Brisbane’s most dynamic sustainability event yet.

This Light Up is organised by: Brisbane Sustainability Agency

item.description:
Friday, 23 May 2025

Reddacliff Place sculptures will be lit Red to celebrate National Volunteer Week

National Volunteer Week is Australia’s largest annual celebration of volunteers and their important contribution to our communities. This special event provides an opportunity to highlight the important role of volunteers in our community and invites people not currently volunteering to give it a go

This Light Up is organised by: Volunteering Queensland

item.title: Light Up the Night Gala
item.description:
Saturday, 24 May 2025

City Hall will be lit Rainbow to celebrate Light Up the Night Gala

Taking place in City Hall, the Light Up the Night Gala is Australia’s premier and purposeful LGBTQ+ fundraising event, hosted by the LGBTQ Domestic Violence Awareness Foundation.
The elegant evening is a chance for hundreds of allies, business leaders, political representatives, community groups and philanthropists to take a visible stand and celebrate an important cause.

This Light Up is organised by: LGBTQ Domestic Violence Awareness Foundation

item.title: Red Shield Appeal
item.description:
Saturday, 24 May 2025

Reddacliff Place sculptures will be lit Red to support Red Shield Appeal

The annual Red Shield Appeal raises awareness of The Salvation Army, and financially supports various vital programs that the Salvation Army has been providing communities in Australia, without discrimination, since 1880. We provide active, practical support designed to meet the social, emotional, material, and spiritual needs of those experiencing hardship through poverty, health issues, dependency issues, unemployment and/or experiencing personal crisis

This Light Up is organised by: Salvation Army

item.title: Cystic Fibrosis Awareness Month
item.description:
Sunday, 25 May 2025

Kangaroo Point Bridge will be lit Red to support Cystic Fibrosis Awareness Month

Since 1960 Cystic Fibrosis Queensland has been the peak not for profit charity providing support, services and hope to people living with cystic fibrosis. Cystic Fibrosis Queensland funds research, advocates on the behalf of and delivers welfare, support, and service programs to people living with cystic fibrosis who attend Qld Health for treatment and support. Our mission is Lives unaffected by Cystic Fibrosis and we assist everyone affected by cystic fibrosis to live fuller, healthier lives.
The month of May is our National Awareness month, with activities taking place across the country to raise funds and awareness for people living with cystic fibrosis

This Light Up is organised by: Cystic Fibrosis Queensland

Venue address: Kangaroo Point Bridge, Scott Street, Kangaroo Point
Venue type: General Council venue, Light up asset

item.title: National Sorry Day
item.description:
Monday, 26 May 2025

Reddacliff Place sculptures will be lit All colours to support National Sorry Day

National Sorry Day - On 26 May 1997 the landmark ‘Bringing them Home’ report was tabled in federal parliament. ‘Bringing them Home’ is the final report of the ‘National Inquiry into the Separation of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Children from Their Families’ and was conducted by the Human Rights and Equal Opportunity Commission (now called the Australian Human Rights Commission) between 1995 and 1997. On 26 May 1998, the first National Sorry Day was held to commemorate the anniversary of the report and remember the grief, suffering and injustice experienced by the stolen generations

This Light Up is organised by: Brisbane City Council

Light up asset: Reddacliff Place, Brisbane City
Venue address: Reddacliff Place, 266 George Street, Brisbane City
Venue type: General Council venue, Light up asset

On 26 May 1998, the first National Sorry Day was held to commemorate the anniversary of the report and remember the grief, suffering and injustice experienced by the stolen generations
This Light Up is organised by: Brisbane City Council

item.title: National Sorry Day
item.description:
Monday, 26 May 2025

Story Bridge will be lit Black Yellow Red and Blue White Green to support National Sorry Day

National Sorry Day - On 26 May 1997 the landmark ‘Bringing them Home’ report was tabled in federal parliament. ‘Bringing them Home’ is the final report of the ‘National Inquiry into the Separation of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Children from Their Families’ and was conducted by the Human Rights and Equal Opportunity Commission (now called the Australian Human Rights Commission) between 1995 and 1997. On 26 May 1998, the first National Sorry Day was held to commemorate the anniversary of the report and remember the grief, suffering and injustice experienced by the stolen generations

This Light Up is organised by: Brisbane City Council

item.title: Eve of LGBTQ Domestic Violence Awareness Day
item.description:
Tuesday, 27 May 2025

Victoria Bridge will be lit Rainbow to support the Eve of LGBTQ Domestic Violence Awareness Day

The creation of the LGBTQ Domestic Violence Awareness Day in 2020 was the first time in history that an awareness day was formed to highlight domestic, family and intimate partner violence and abuse occurring in LGBTQ+ communities. Held annually on May 28, LGBTQ Domestic Violence Awareness Day is the only day like it in the world.
What started in Australia, is now a global event with hundreds of government departments and organisations from 17 countries recognising the day

This Light Up is organised by: LGBTQ Domestic Violence Awareness Foundation

Light up asset: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City
Venue address: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City
Venue type: General Council venue, Light up asset

item.description:
Wednesday, 28 May 2025

Reddacliff Place sculptures will be lit Maroon to celebrate State of Origin - Game I Brisbane

Mark your diaries, Queenslanders! The Queensland Maroons are looking for redemption in 2025! State of Origin is Australia’s greatest sporting rivalry with the 2025 series starting at the home of the Maroons - Brisbane’s Suncorp Stadium, host to Game One on Wednesday, May 28.

item.title: Darkness to Daylight
item.description:
Thursday, 29 May 2025

Story Bridge will be lit Purple to support Darkness to Daylight

The Darkness to Daylight event is Challenge DV's flagship fundraising and awareness event which consists of a 110km overnight run, 110km monthly running challenge, and a 10km and 3km community mass-participation event. It is a month-long campaign to raise much needed funds to support Domestic Violence prevention programs. www.darknesstodaylight.org

This Light Up is organised by: Challenge DV

item.title: World MS Day
item.description:
Friday, 30 May 2025

City Hall will be lit Red to support World MS Day

World MS Day is an international awareness day for everyone affected by multiple sclerosis (MS). It brings the global MS community together to share stories, raise awareness and campaign for change. World MS Day is officially marked on the 30 May and is such an important day for people living with MS as they see they are not alone and are supported by the wider community.

This Light Up is organised by: MS Queensland

Light up asset: Brisbane City Hall, Brisbane City
Venue address: Brisbane City Hall, 64 Adelaide Street, Brisbane City
Venue type: General Council venue, Library, Light up asset

item.title: Brisbane Marathon Festival
item.description:
Saturday, 31 May 2025

Kangaroo Point Bridge will be lit Blue to celebrate the Brisbane Marathon Festival

Celebrating our 33rd year in 2025, the Brisbane Marathon Festival is one of the oldest and most friendly events on the Australian running calendar attracting thousands of participants from over 35 countries annually. The marathon festival includes a half marathon, a 10 km run, a 5 km run/walk and a children's 2 km 'mini marathon'. The event celebrates fun fitness and the test of ultimate human endurance – the Marathon

This Light Up is organised by: Brisbane Economic Development Agency

The marathon festival includes a half marathon, a 10 km run, a 5 km run/walk and a children's 2 km 'mini marathon'. The event celebrates fun fitness and the test of ultimate human endurance – the Marathon
This Light Up is organised by: Brisbane Economic Development Agency

item.title: Dancing CEO's
item.description:
Saturday, 31 May 2025

City Hall will be lit Purple to celebrate Dancing CEO's

Dancing CEOs is one of Brisbane's greatest gala events for a cause. CEOs & leaders bravely swap the boardroom for the dance floor in front of Corporate Queensland. The event is in celebrate of domestic violence prevention and raises vital funds for the legal & social services provided by WLSQ

This Light Up is organised by: Womens' Legal Services Queensland

Light up asset: Brisbane City Hall, Brisbane City
Venue address: Brisbane City Hall, 64 Adelaide Street, Brisbane City
Venue type: General Council venue, Library, Light up asset

item.title: National Reconciliation Week
item.description:
Sunday, 1 June 2025

Kangaroo Point Bridge will be lit Black, Yellow, Red Alternating with Blue, White, Green to support National Reconciliation Week.

27 May to 3 June 2025  is National Reconciliation Week - the theme for National Reconciliation Week 2025, “Bridging Now to Next” urges us to look ahead and continue the push forward as past lessons guide us.

This Light Up is organised by: Brisbane City Council
